option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"/Users/Shiva/StudioProjects/Litep2p":"{\"/app/src/main/cpp/include/peer.h\":\"This file defines a `Peer` struct, which represents a peer in a network. The struct contains information about the peer, such as its ID, IP address, port, latency, connection status, and the last time it was seen.\\n\\nThere are no classes or functions defined in this file. The file simply provides a data structure to represent a peer in a network.\",\"/app/src/main/cpp/src/discovery.cpp\":\"`DiscoveryImpl`: Implements the discovery functionality, including starting and stopping the discovery process, handling incoming discovery messages, and broadcasting discovery messages.\\n\\n`getGlobalDiscoveryInstance`: Returns a global instance of the `Discovery` class.\\n\\n`Discovery`: Provides an interface for managing the discovery process, including starting and stopping the discovery, and setting a callback function to handle discovered peers.\\n\\nThis file implements a discovery mechanism for a peer-to-peer (P2P) network. It uses UDP broadcasting to discover other peers on the network and provides a callback mechanism to notify the application when new peers are discovered.\",\"/app/src/main/cpp/src/peer_manager.cpp\":\"`PeerManagerImpl`: Manages the network connections and communication between peers.\\n\\n`PeerManager::PeerManager()`: Constructor for the PeerManager class.\\n`PeerManager::~PeerManager()`: Destructor for the PeerManager class.\\n`PeerManager::start(int p)`: Starts the server on the specified port.\\n`PeerManager::stop()`: Stops the server and clears the list of peers.\\n`PeerManager::connectTo(const std::string\\u0026 i, int p)`: Connects to a peer at the specified IP and port.\\n`PeerManager::sendDirect(const std::string\\u0026 pid, const std::string\\u0026 m)`: Sends a message directly to the specified peer.\\n`PeerManager::setPeerUpdateCallback(std::function\\u003cvoid(const std::vector\\u003cPeer\\u003e\\u0026)\\u003e cb)`: Sets a callback function to be called when the list of peers is updated.\\n`PeerManager::broadcastMessage(const std::string\\u0026 msg)`: Broadcasts a message to all connected peers.\\n\\nThis file implements a PeerManager class that manages the network connections and communication between peers in a peer-to-peer network.\",\"/app/src/main/app/src/main/cpp/include/network.h\":\"`Network`: A class that manages a network server and client connections, providing functionality for starting and stopping the server, connecting to peers, sending data to peers, and setting a callback for handling received data.\\n\\n`Network()`: Constructs a new `Network` object.\\n\\n`~Network()`: Destroys the `Network` object.\\n\\n`startServer(int port)`: Starts the network server on the specified port.\\n\\n`stopServer()`: Stops the network server.\\n\\n`connectToPeer(const std::string \\u0026ip, int port, std::string \\u0026peerId)`: Connects to a peer at the specified IP address and port, and returns the assigned peer ID.\\n\\n`sendToPeer(const std::string \\u0026peerId, const std::string \\u0026data)`: Sends the specified data to the peer with the given ID.\\n\\n`setDataCallback(DataCallback cb)`: Sets the callback function to be called when data is received from a peer.\\n\\n`onAcceptEvent(int fd, uint32_t events)`: Handles the acceptance of a new connection.\\n\\n`onConnectionEvent(int fd, uint32_t events)`: Handles events related to an existing connection.\\n\\n`closeConnection(int fd)`: Closes the connection with the specified file descriptor.\\n\\nThis file defines a `Network` class that provides a network server and client functionality, including the ability to start and stop the server, connect to peers, send data to peers, and set a callback for handling received data.\",\"/app/src/main/app/src/main/cpp/include/peer_manager.h\":\"`PeerManager`: A class that manages the connection and communication between peers in a network.\\n\\n`~PeerManager()`: The destructor for the `PeerManager` class.\\n\\n`startServer(int port)`: Starts a server on the specified port.\\n\\n`stop()`: Stops the server.\\n\\n`connect(const std::string\\u0026 ip, int port)`: Connects to a peer at the specified IP address and port.\\n\\n`send(const std::string\\u0026 peerId, const std::vector\\u003cuint8_t\\u003e\\u0026 data)`: Sends data to the specified peer.\\n\\n`setCallback(std::function\\u003cvoid(const std::vector\\u003cPeer\\u003e\\u0026)\\u003e cb)`: Sets a callback function to be called when the list of peers changes.\\n\\n`notify()`: Notifies the callback function of changes to the list of peers.\\n\\n`updatePeer(const Peer\\u0026 p)`: Updates the information about a peer in the list of peers.\\n\\n`g_peerManager`: A global instance of the `PeerManager` class.\",\"/app/src/androidTest/java/com/zeengal/litep2p/ExampleInstrumentedTest.kt\":\"This file contains an instrumented test for an Android application. It does not define any classes or functions, but rather tests the application\\u0027s context to ensure that the package name matches the expected value.\\n\\nThe file can be summarized as follows:\\n\\nThe `ExampleInstrumentedTest` class is an instrumented test that runs on an Android device and checks the package name of the application under test.\\n\\nThe `useAppContext()` function retrieves the application context and asserts that the package name matches the expected value.\",\"/app/src/main/cpp/include/peer_manager.h\":\"`PeerManagerImpl`: This class is the implementation of the `PeerManager` class, which is not exposed in the header file.\\n\\n`PeerManager`: This class manages the peer-to-peer communication, including starting and stopping the server, connecting to other peers, broadcasting messages, and sending direct messages to specific peers.\\n\\n`start(int port)`: This function starts the peer-to-peer server on the specified port.\\n\\n`stop()`: This function stops the peer-to-peer server.\\n\\n`connectTo(const std::string\\u0026 ip, int port)`: This function connects to a peer at the specified IP address and port.\\n\\n`broadcastMessage(const std::string\\u0026 msg)`: This function broadcasts a message to all connected peers.\\n\\n`sendDirect(const std::string\\u0026 peerId, const std::string\\u0026 msg)`: This function sends a direct message to a specific peer identified by the `peerId`.\\n\\n`setPeerUpdateCallback(std::function\\u003cvoid(const std::vector\\u003cPeer\\u003e\\u0026)\\u003e cb)`: This function sets a callback function that will be called whenever the list of connected peers changes.\\n\\n`g_peerManager`: This is a global instance of the `PeerManager` class.\",\"/app/src/main/app/src/main/cpp/src/network.cpp\":\"This file appears to be an implementation of a network server and client functionality. It does not contain any classes, but rather a set of functions that handle the server and client operations. Here\\u0027s a summary of the functions:\\n\\n`Network()`: Constructs a `Network` object and initializes the server file descriptor to -1.\\n\\n`~Network()`: Destructor that stops the server.\\n\\n`startServer(int port)`: Starts a server that listens on the specified port.\\n\\n`stopServer()`: Stops the server and closes all active connections.\\n\\n`onAcceptEvent(int fd, uint32_t events)`: Handles the acceptance of a new client connection.\\n\\n`connectToPeer(const std::string \\u0026ip, int port, std::string \\u0026peerId)`: Connects to a peer at the specified IP and port.\\n\\n`onConnectionEvent(int fd, uint32_t events)`: Handles events related to an active connection.\\n\\n`closeConnection(int fd)`: Closes a connection and removes it from the internal data structures.\\n\\n`sendToPeer(const std::string \\u0026peerId, const std::string \\u0026data)`: Sends data to a peer identified by the peerId.\\n\\n`setDataCallback(DataCallback cb)`: Sets a callback function to be called when data is received from a peer.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/zeengal/litep2p/LiteP2PLogger.kt\":\"This file defines an interface called `LiteP2PLogger` which provides a single function `onNativeLog` that allows logging messages from the native code.\\n\\n`LiteP2PLogger`: An interface that defines a logger for the LiteP2P library.\\n\\n`onNativeLog`: A function that allows logging messages from the native code.\",\"/app/src/main/app/src/main/cpp/include/peer.h\":\"This file defines a `Peer` struct, which represents a peer in a network. The struct contains information about the peer, such as its ID, IP address, port, latency, connection status, and the last time it was seen.\\n\\nThere are no classes or functions defined in this file. The file simply provides a data structure to represent a peer in a network.\",\"/app/src/main/cpp/include/jni_glue.h\":\"This file is a header file that defines the interface for a JNI (Java Native Interface) glue layer. It does not contain any class definitions, but rather defines several functions that can be used to interact with the JNI layer.\\n\\n`jniGlueInit`: Initializes the JNI glue layer by attaching the current thread to the JVM and obtaining a reference to a specific Java class.\\n\\n`jniGlueCleanup`: Cleans up the JNI glue layer by detaching the current thread from the JVM.\\n\\n`sendPeersToUI`: Sends a vector of `Peer` objects to the UI (user interface) through the JNI layer.\",\"/app/src/main/app/src/main/cpp/include/discovery.h\":\"`Discovery`: A class that provides functionality for peer discovery in a peer-to-peer network.\\n\\n`DiscoveryImpl`: A private implementation class for the `Discovery` class.\\n\\n`DiscoveryCb`: A type alias for a function pointer that takes a `Peer` object as a parameter and returns void.\\n\\n`Discovery()`: Constructs a new `Discovery` object.\\n\\n`~Discovery()`: Destroys the `Discovery` object.\\n\\n`start(int port)`: Starts the discovery process on the specified port.\\n\\n`stop()`: Stops the discovery process.\\n\\n`setCallback(DiscoveryCb cb)`: Sets the callback function to be called when a new peer is discovered.\\n\\n`getGlobalDiscoveryInstance()`: Returns a global instance of the `Discovery` class.\",\"/app/src/main/app/src/main/cpp/src/epoll_reactor.cpp\":\"This file appears to be an implementation of an `EpollReactor` class, which is a reactor pattern implementation using the `epoll` system call in Linux. The file also includes a few helper functions. Here\\u0027s a summary of the classes and functions:\\n\\n`EpollReactor`: A reactor pattern implementation that uses the `epoll` system call to efficiently manage I/O events.\\n\\n`setNonBlocking`: A helper function that sets a file descriptor to non-blocking mode.\\n`EpollReactor::EpollReactor`: Initializes the `EpollReactor` instance, creating an `epoll` file descriptor and a wake-up file descriptor.\\n`EpollReactor::~EpollReactor`: Stops the reactor and cleans up the resources.\\n`EpollReactor::start`: Starts the reactor\\u0027s event loop in a separate thread.\\n`EpollReactor::stop`: Stops the reactor\\u0027s event loop.\\n`EpollReactor::add`: Adds a file descriptor and its associated event callback to the reactor.\\n`EpollReactor::modify`: Modifies the events associated with a file descriptor in the reactor.\\n`EpollReactor::remove`: Removes a file descriptor from the reactor.\\n`EpollReactor::post`: Schedules a task to be executed by the reactor.\\n`EpollReactor::wakeUp`: Wakes up the reactor\\u0027s event loop.\\n`EpollReactor::loop`: The main event loop of the reactor, which waits for and handles I/O events.\",\"/app/src/main/app/src/main/cpp/src/p2p_api.cpp\":\"This file is a C++ implementation of a P2P (Peer-to-Peer) networking library, with the following functions:\\n\\n`Java_com_zeengal_litep2p_hook_P2P_init`: Initializes the P2P library, linking the PeerManager to the JNI UI and the Discovery module to the PeerManager.\\n\\n`Java_com_zeengal_litep2p_hook_P2P_startServer`: Starts the P2P server and the Discovery module.\\n\\n`Java_com_zeengal_litep2p_hook_P2P_connect`: Connects to a remote peer.\\n\\n`Java_com_zeengal_litep2p_hook_P2P_sendMessage`: Sends a message to a remote peer.\\n\\n`Java_com_zeengal_litep2p_hook_P2P_stop`: Stops the P2P server and the Discovery module.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any class definitions, but rather a set of JNI (Java Native Interface) functions that interact with a P2P networking library.\",\"/app/src/main/cpp/src/network.cpp\":\"This file appears to be an implementation of a network server using the Epoll reactor pattern. It includes the following classes and functions:\\n\\n`PeerConnection`: A struct that represents a connection with a peer, including the file descriptor, peer ID, receive buffer, and connection status.\\n\\n`NetworkImpl`: The main implementation of the network server, responsible for starting and stopping the server, accepting connections, handling I/O events, and managing the connections.\\n\\n`NetworkImpl::startServer`: Starts the network server and listens for incoming connections on the specified port.\\n`NetworkImpl::stop`: Stops the network server and the underlying Epoll reactor.\\n`NetworkImpl::connectPeer`: Connects to a remote peer at the specified IP and port.\\n`NetworkImpl::sendData`: Sends data to a connected peer identified by the peer ID.\\n`NetworkImpl::setCallbacks`: Sets the callbacks for handling received data and disconnection events.\\n`NetworkImpl::acceptConn`: Accepts a new incoming connection and registers it with the connection manager.\\n`NetworkImpl::registerConnection`: Registers a new connection with the connection manager.\\n`NetworkImpl::handleIo`: Handles I/O events for a connected peer, including receiving data and detecting disconnections.\\n`NetworkImpl::closeConn`: Closes a connection and notifies the disconnect callback.\\n`NetworkImpl::getFd`: Retrieves the file descriptor for a connected peer identified by the peer ID.\\n`NetworkImpl::checkHeartbeats`: Checks for idle connections and performs heartbeat-related logic (not implemented in the provided code).\\n\\n`Network`: A wrapper class that provides a high-level interface for the `NetworkImpl` implementation.\",\"/app/src/main/pledge copy.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it creates a ZIP file containing the source code for a C++ library called \\\"LiteP2P\\\". The source code includes the following components:\\n\\n1. `cpp/CMakeLists.txt`: The build script for the LiteP2P library, which points to the \\u0027src\\u0027 folder instead of \\u0027source\\u0027 to match the image.\\n2. `cpp/include/`: Clean, dependency-free headers using the Pimpl idiom, including `epoll_reactor.h`, `network.h`, `peer_manager.h`, `discovery.h`, `peer.h`, `logger.h`, `jni_glue.h`, and `jni_helpers.h`.\\n3. `cpp/src/`: Implementations of the robust logic, including `epoll_reactor.cpp`, `network.cpp`, `peer_manager.cpp`, `discovery.cpp`, `p2p_api.cpp`, `jni_glue.cpp`, and `logger.cpp`.\\n\\nThe main purpose of this file is to create a ZIP archive containing the source code for the LiteP2P library, which can be used in a larger project.\",\"/app/src/main/cpp/include/network.h\":\"`NetworkImpl`: This class is not defined in the provided code, but it is likely the implementation of the `Network` class.\\n\\n`Network`: This class provides an interface for a network communication system, allowing for starting a server, connecting to a server, sending data, and setting callbacks for data reception and disconnection events.\\n\\n`DataCallback`: This is a function type alias for a callback function that is called when data is received from a peer.\\n\\n`DisconnectCallback`: This is a function type alias for a callback function that is called when a peer disconnects.\\n\\n`Network()`: This is the constructor for the `Network` class.\\n\\n`~Network()`: This is the destructor for the `Network` class.\\n\\n`startServer(int port)`: This function starts a server on the specified port.\\n\\n`stop()`: This function stops the server.\\n\\n`connect(const std::string \\u0026ip, int port)`: This function connects to a server at the specified IP address and port.\\n\\n`send(const std::string \\u0026peerId, const std::string \\u0026data)`: This function sends data to the specified peer.\\n\\n`setCallbacks(DataCallback onData, DisconnectCallback onDisconnect)`: This function sets the callbacks for data reception and disconnection events.\",\"/app/src/main/app/src/main/cpp/src/discovery.cpp\":\"`DiscoveryImpl`: Implements the discovery functionality, including starting and stopping the discovery process, handling discovery requests and responses, and broadcasting discovery messages.\\n\\n`getGlobalDiscoveryInstance()`: Returns a global instance of the `Discovery` class.\\n\\n`Discovery`: Provides an interface for managing the discovery process, including starting and stopping the discovery, and setting a callback function to handle discovered peers.\\n\\nThis file implements a discovery mechanism for a peer-to-peer (P2P) network. It includes a `DiscoveryImpl` class that handles the low-level details of the discovery process, including listening for discovery requests, responding to them, and periodically broadcasting discovery messages. The `Discovery` class provides a higher-level interface for managing the discovery process, allowing users to start and stop the discovery, and set a callback function to handle discovered peers.\",\"/app/src/main/cpp/include/p2p_api.h\":\"This file appears to be a header file for a P2P (Peer-to-Peer) API, and it does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it includes the necessary header file `\\u003cjni.h\\u003e` for the Java Native Interface (JNI) and defines preprocessor macros to prevent multiple inclusions of the header file.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to provide a common interface for interacting with a P2P system using the JNI, which allows Java code to call and be called by native code (such as C or C++).\",\"/app/src/main/cpp/include/epoll_reactor.h\":\"`EpollReactorImpl`: This class is not defined in the provided code, but it is likely an implementation detail of the `EpollReactor` class.\\n\\n`EpollReactor`: This class provides an event-driven reactor pattern using the epoll mechanism, allowing for efficient handling of I/O events and scheduling of tasks and timers.\\n\\n`EventCallback`: This is a function type used to represent callbacks for handling I/O events.\\n\\n`Task`: This is a function type used to represent tasks that can be posted to the reactor.\\n\\n`TimerId`: This is an integer type used to represent a unique identifier for a timer.\\n\\n`EpollReactor()`: This is the constructor for the `EpollReactor` class.\\n\\n`~EpollReactor()`: This is the destructor for the `EpollReactor` class.\\n\\n`start()`: This function starts the event loop of the `EpollReactor`.\\n\\n`stop()`: This function stops the event loop of the `EpollReactor`.\\n\\n`add(int fd, uint32_t events, EventCallback cb)`: This function adds a file descriptor to the `EpollReactor` with the specified events and callback.\\n\\n`remove(int fd)`: This function removes a file descriptor from the `EpollReactor`.\\n\\n`post(Task t)`: This function posts a task to the `EpollReactor` for execution.\\n\\n`runAfter(int milliseconds, Task t)`: This function schedules a task to be executed after the specified number of milliseconds.\\n\\n`runEvery(int milliseconds, Task t)`: This function schedules a task to be executed repeatedly every specified number of milliseconds.\\n\\n`cancelTimer(TimerId id)`: This function cancels a timer with the specified ID.\",\"/app/src/main/cpp/src/p2p_api.cpp\":\"This file appears to be a C++ source file that contains JNI (Java Native Interface) functions for a P2P (Peer-to-Peer) networking library. It does not define any classes, but rather contains several functions that interact with the `PeerManager` and `Discovery` components of the library. Here\\u0027s a summary of each function:\\n\\n`Java_com_zeengal_litep2p_hook_P2P_init`: Initializes the P2P library and sets up callbacks for peer updates and discovery.\\n`Java_com_zeengal_litep2p_hook_P2P_startServer`: Starts the P2P server and discovery service on the specified port.\\n`Java_com_zeengal_litep2p_hook_P2P_connect`: Connects to a remote peer with the specified IP address and port.\\n`Java_com_zeengal_litep2p_hook_P2P_sendMessage`: Sends a message to a remote peer with the specified ID.\\n`Java_com_zeengal_litep2p_hook_P2P_stop`: Stops the P2P server and discovery service.\\n\\nThe file also includes several header file includes, such as `jni.h`, `string`, `vector`, `peer_manager.h`, `discovery.h`, `logger.h`, and `jni_glue.h`, which suggests that this file is part of a larger P2P networking library.\",\"/settings.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle build configuration file for an Android application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the following:\\n\\n`pluginManagement`: Configures the repositories to be used for resolving Gradle plugins.\\n`dependencyResolutionManagement`: Configures the repositories to be used for resolving project dependencies.\\n`rootProject.name`: Sets the name of the root project to \\\"My Application\\\".\\n`include(\\\":app\\\")`: Includes the \\\":app\\\" module in the project.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to set up the build environment for an Android application, including the repositories to be used for resolving dependencies and plugins, and the structure of the project.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/zeengal/litep2p/ui/home/PeerAdapter.kt\":\"`PeersAdapter`: A RecyclerView adapter that displays a list of `PeerInfo` objects, showing their ID, connection status, IP address, port, and latency.\\n\\n`onCreateViewHolder`: Creates a new `Holder` instance for each item in the RecyclerView.\\n\\n`onBindViewHolder`: Binds the data from a `PeerInfo` object to the views in the `Holder` instance.\\n\\n`getItemCount`: Returns the number of items in the adapter.\\n\\n`update`: Updates the list of `PeerInfo` objects and notifies the RecyclerView of the changes.\\n\\nThis file contains the implementation of the `PeersAdapter` class, which is responsible for managing the display of a list of `PeerInfo` objects in a RecyclerView. The adapter handles the creation and binding of view holders, as well as providing a method to update the list of items.\",\"/app/src/main/cpp/include/logger.h\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`setLoggerTarget`: Sets the logger target to the provided Java activity object.\\n\\n`nativeLog`: Logs the provided message.\\n\\n`loggerSetJavaVM`: Sets the Java virtual machine for the logger.\\n\\nThis file appears to be a header file that provides a set of functions for logging and interacting with a Java virtual machine from a native C++ environment.\",\"/app/src/main/cpp/src/logger.cpp\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`loggerSetJavaVM`: This function is a placeholder and does not perform any meaningful operation.\\n\\n`setLoggerTarget`: This function sets the Java target object and the method ID for the `onNativeLog` method, which is used to log messages from the native code to the Java side.\\n\\n`nativeLog`: This function logs a message to the Android log and, if a Java target object and method ID are set, it calls the `onNativeLog` method on the Java side to log the message.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to provide a logging mechanism that can be used to send messages from the native code to the Java side of an Android application.\",\"/app/src/main/cpp/src/epoll_reactor.cpp\":\"This file implements an `EpollReactor` class, which is a reactor pattern implementation using the Linux `epoll` system call. It provides an event-driven, asynchronous I/O model for managing network connections and timers.\\n\\n`Timer`: A struct representing a timer with an ID, expiration time, interval, and a task to be executed.\\n\\n`nowMs()`: A helper function that returns the current time in milliseconds.\\n\\n`EpollReactorImpl`: The implementation of the `EpollReactor` class, which manages the event loop, file descriptors, tasks, and timers.\\n\\n`EpollReactor`: The public-facing class that wraps the `EpollReactorImpl` and provides a simple interface for users to interact with the reactor.\\n\\n`start()`: Starts the reactor\\u0027s event loop in a separate thread.\\n`stop()`: Stops the reactor\\u0027s event loop.\\n`wakeUp()`: Wakes up the reactor\\u0027s event loop.\\n`add()`: Adds a file descriptor and associated callback to the reactor.\\n`remove()`: Removes a file descriptor from the reactor.\\n`post()`: Schedules a task to be executed by the reactor.\\n`runAfter()`: Schedules a task to be executed after a specified delay.\\n`runEvery()`: Schedules a task to be executed repeatedly at a specified interval.\\n`cancelTimer()`: Cancels a timer by its ID.\",\"/app/src/main/app/src/main/cpp/include/logger.h\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`setLoggerTarget`: Sets the logger target to the provided Java activity object.\\n\\n`nativeLog`: Logs the provided message.\\n\\n`loggerSetJavaVM`: Sets the Java Virtual Machine for the logger.\\n\\nThis file appears to be a header file that provides a set of functions for logging and interacting with a Java Virtual Machine from a native C++ environment.\",\"/app/src/main/cpp/src/jni_glue.cpp\":\"This file appears to be a C++ implementation of a JNI (Java Native Interface) glue layer for an Android P2P (Peer-to-Peer) application. It includes the following classes and functions:\\n\\n`jni_glue.h`: Provides a header file for the JNI glue layer.\\n`jni_helpers.h`: Provides helper functions for working with the JNI environment.\\n`logger.h`: Provides logging functionality.\\n\\n`jniGlueInit`: Initializes the JNI glue layer.\\n`jniGlueCleanup`: Cleans up the JNI glue layer.\\n`sendPeersToUI`: Sends a list of peers to the Android UI, creating and populating a Java array of `PeerInfo` objects.\\n\\nThe file does not define any classes, but rather provides a set of functions to facilitate communication between the native C++ code and the Android Java code.\",\"/app/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle build script for an Android application. It sets up the project configuration, including the Android SDK version, build features, and dependencies. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather configures the build process for the Android application.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/zeengal/litep2p/ui/peers/PeersFragment.kt\":\"`PeersFragment`: A Fragment class that represents the UI for displaying a list of peers in a P2P application.\\n\\n`onCreateView`: Inflates the `FragmentPeersBinding` layout and returns the root view.\\n\\n`onDestroyView`: Cleans up the `_binding` variable when the view is destroyed.\\n\\nThis file defines a `PeersFragment` class, which is a Fragment that represents the UI for displaying a list of peers in a P2P application. The `onCreateView` function inflates the `FragmentPeersBinding` layout and returns the root view, while the `onDestroyView` function cleans up the `_binding` variable when the view is destroyed.\",\"/app/src/test/java/com/zeengal/litep2p/ExampleUnitTest.kt\":\"This file contains a single unit test class with one test function. The file does not define any classes or functions, but rather contains a single unit test that verifies the correctness of the addition operation.\\n\\n`ExampleUnitTest`: A unit test class that contains a single test case to verify the correctness of the addition operation.\\n\\n`addition_isCorrect()`: A test function that checks if the addition of 2 and 2 results in 4, which is the expected outcome.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/zeengal/litep2p/NativeCallback.kt\":\"This file does not contain any classes, but it does contain the following functions:\\n\\n`NativeCallback`: This object serves as a bridge between the native code and the Android UI, providing a way to update the UI with a list of `PeerInfo` objects.\\n\\n`onPeersUpdate(peersArray: Array\\u003cPeerInfo\\u003e)`: This function is called from the native code to update the list of peers, and it posts the new list of `PeerInfo` objects to the `_peers` LiveData object, which can be observed by the UI.\",\"/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a top-level build file that sets up common configuration options for all sub-projects or modules in the Android application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather sets up the necessary plugins for the Android application and Kotlin Android development.\\n\\nThe file performs the following tasks:\\n\\n1. Applies the Android application plugin to all sub-projects or modules.\\n2. Applies the Kotlin Android plugin to all sub-projects or modules.\\n\\nThese plugins provide the necessary build configuration and dependencies for the Android application and Kotlin Android development, ensuring a consistent setup across all sub-projects or modules.\",\"/app/src/main/cpp/src/jni_helpers.cpp\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`getJNIEnv()`: This function retrieves the JNIEnv* for the current thread, attaching the current thread to the JavaVM if necessary.\\n\\n`JNI_OnLoad(JavaVM* vm, void*)`: This function is called when the native library is loaded, and it stores the JavaVM* in the global variable `g_vm`.\\n\\nThis file is a set of helper functions for working with the Java Native Interface (JNI) in an Android application. It provides a way to get the JNIEnv* for the current thread, which is necessary for calling Java methods from native code.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/zeengal/litep2p/hook/p2p.kt\":\"This file appears to be a Kotlin object named `P2P` that serves as a wrapper for a native library called \\\"litep2p\\\". It provides a set of functions to initialize, start, and stop a P2P server, connect to a peer, and send messages. The file also includes a static function `onPeersUpdated` that is intended to be a callback for UI updates when the list of peers is updated.\\n\\n`P2P`: A Kotlin object that provides a set of functions to interact with a native P2P library.\\n\\n`init`: Loads the \\\"litep2p\\\" native library.\\n`init`: Initializes the P2P library.\\n`startServer`: Starts a P2P server on the specified port.\\n`connect`: Connects to a peer at the specified IP and port.\\n`sendMessage`: Sends a message to the specified peer.\\n`stop`: Stops the P2P server.\\n`onPeersUpdated`: A static function that is intended to be a callback for UI updates when the list of peers is updated.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/zeengal/litep2p/MainActivity.kt\":\"This file appears to be the implementation of the `MainActivity` class in an Android application that uses the `LiteP2P` library. The file contains the following classes and functions:\\n\\n`MainActivity`: The main activity of the Android application that provides a user interface for starting and stopping the `LiteP2P` library.\\n\\n`nativeStartLiteP2P()`: A native function that starts the `LiteP2P` library.\\n\\n`nativeStopLiteP2P()`: A native function that stops the `LiteP2P` library.\\n\\n`onNativeLog(message: String)`: A function that is called from the native `LiteP2P` library to log messages.\\n\\n`appendLog(msg: String)`: A function that appends a message to the log text view in the user interface.\\n\\nThe file also includes a static block that loads the `litep2p` native library.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/zeengal/litep2p/ui/home/HomeFragment.kt\":\"This file contains a single class and several functions:\\n\\n`HomeFragment`: A Fragment class that displays a list of peers and provides buttons to start and stop a P2P server.\\n\\n`onCreateView`: Inflates the fragment\\u0027s layout and returns the root view.\\n`onViewCreated`: Sets up the RecyclerView to display the list of peers, observes the `NativeCallback.peers` LiveData, and wires up the start and stop buttons.\\n`onDestroyView`: Cleans up the binding and calls the superclass\\u0027s `onDestroyView`.\\n\\nThis file is responsible for the UI and functionality of the \\\"Home\\\" screen in the Lite P2P application, which allows users to view a list of connected peers and control the P2P server.\",\"/app/src/main/cpp/include/jni_helpers.h\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`getJNIEnv()`: This function retrieves the current Java Native Interface (JNI) environment for the calling thread.\\n\\nThe file also declares a global variable `g_vm` of type `JavaVM*`, which is likely used to store a reference to the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) instance.\\n\\nOverall, this file appears to be a header file that provides utility functions and global variables for working with the Java Native Interface (JNI) in a C/C++ application.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/zeengal/litep2p/PeerInfo.kt\":\"This file contains a single data class:\\n\\n`PeerInfo`: A data class that represents information about a peer in a peer-to-peer network, including its ID, IP address, port, latency, and connection status.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It simply defines a data class to encapsulate information about a peer in a peer-to-peer network.\",\"/app/src/main/app/src/main/cpp/src/peer_manager.cpp\":\"This file appears to be a C++ implementation of a `PeerManager` class, which is responsible for managing a network of peers. Here\\u0027s a summary of the classes and functions in the file:\\n\\n`PeerManager`: A class that manages a network of peers, including starting a server, connecting to peers, sending data to peers, and notifying callbacks about peer updates.\\n\\n`PeerManager::~PeerManager()`: The destructor for the `PeerManager` class, which stops the server.\\n\\n`PeerManager::startServer(int port)`: Starts a server on the specified port and sets up a callback for receiving data from peers.\\n\\n`PeerManager::stop()`: Stops the server and clears the list of peers.\\n\\n`PeerManager::connect(const std::string\\u0026 ip, int port)`: Connects to a peer at the specified IP address and port.\\n\\n`PeerManager::send(const std::string\\u0026 peerId, const std::vector\\u003cuint8_t\\u003e\\u0026 data)`: Sends data to the specified peer.\\n\\n`PeerManager::setCallback(std::function\\u003cvoid(const std::vector\\u003cPeer\\u003e\\u0026)\\u003e cb)`: Sets a callback function to be called when the list of peers is updated.\\n\\n`PeerManager::updatePeer(const Peer\\u0026 p)`: Updates the information for a peer in the list of peers and notifies the callback function.\\n\\n`PeerManager::notify()`: Notifies the callback function with a copy of the current list of peers.\",\"/README.md\":\"This file is a README.md document that provides an overview of the LiteP2P library, which is a lightweight peer-to-peer networking library written in C++ and optimized for Android performance, battery life, and reliability. The document covers the key features, architecture, installation, and a quick start example of the library. It also mentions a roadmap for future development and information about contributing and licensing.\\n\\nThere are no specific classes or functions listed in this file. The document serves as a high-level introduction and guide for the LiteP2P library.\",\"/app/src/main/app/src/main/cpp/include/epoll_reactor.h\":\"`EventType`: Enum representing different types of events (read, write, error).\\n\\n`EventCallback`: Function type for event callbacks, taking a file descriptor and event mask.\\n\\n`Task`: Function type for tasks to be executed on the reactor thread.\\n\\n`EpollReactor`: A class that provides an event-driven reactor pattern using the epoll mechanism.\\n\\n`EpollReactor::EpollReactor()`: Constructor for the `EpollReactor` class.\\n\\n`EpollReactor::~EpollReactor()`: Destructor for the `EpollReactor` class.\\n\\n`EpollReactor::start()`: Starts the event loop in a background thread.\\n\\n`EpollReactor::stop()`: Stops the event loop.\\n\\n`EpollReactor::add()`: Registers a file descriptor for events and an associated callback.\\n\\n`EpollReactor::modify()`: Modifies the monitored events for a registered file descriptor.\\n\\n`EpollReactor::remove()`: Removes a file descriptor from the event monitoring.\\n\\n`EpollReactor::post()`: Runs a task on the reactor thread in a thread-safe manner.\\n\\n`EpollReactor::loop()`: The main event loop that waits for and handles events.\\n\\n`EpollReactor::wakeUp()`: Interrupts the `epoll_wait` call to allow the event loop to be stopped.\",\"/app/src/main/cpp/include/discovery.h\":\"`Discovery`: A class that provides functionality for peer discovery in a peer-to-peer network.\\n\\n`DiscoveryImpl`: A private implementation class for the `Discovery` class.\\n\\n`DiscoveryCb`: A type alias for a function pointer that takes a `Peer` object as a parameter and returns void.\\n\\n`Discovery()`: Constructs a new `Discovery` object.\\n\\n`~Discovery()`: Destroys the `Discovery` object.\\n\\n`start(int port)`: Starts the discovery process on the specified port.\\n\\n`stop()`: Stops the discovery process.\\n\\n`setCallback(DiscoveryCb cb)`: Sets the callback function to be called when a new peer is discovered.\\n\\n`getGlobalDiscoveryInstance()`: Returns a global instance of the `Discovery` class.\"}"}
